data.description: Job Classification:Technology - Software Development/Quality EngineeringPGIM: 2026 Quantitative Solutions, Investment Technology Summer Associate Internship (MBA/Masters)Location(s):Newark, NJ (Hybrid)PGIM Quant Solutions is a pioneer of quantitative investing, providing equity and global multi-asset solutions. Serving investors since 1975, PGIM Quant Solutions targets superior risk-adjusted returns by combining research-driven quantitative processes built on academic, economic and behavioral foundations with discernment from expert market practitioners. PGIM Quant Solutions manages over $100 billion for institutional and retail clients. It is a subsidiary of Prudential Financial.  As a leader in scientifically-based, process-driven active investing, the firm’s research process begins with economically sound hypotheses, which are then tested with empirical data.  All validated insights are included into a process that broadly and systematically applies those insights.We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented Software Development Intern to join our team. We are a technology group embedded within the investment team at PGIM Quantitative Solutions. We report to the Chief Investment Officer and often interact and collaborate with portfolio managers, researchers and investment associates to develop customized software solutions. This internship offers a balanced opportunity to gain hands-on experience in back-end development while contributing to front-end projects. You will work on building and maintaining scalable systems, integrating APIs, and developing user-friendly interfaces using modern technologies.Timeline: Program Dates: Monday, June 1st, 2026 – Friday, August 7th, 2026Application Deadline: Friday, February 6th, 2026 (We review applications on a rolling basis and reserve the right to close earlier based on volume or role availability.)What you can expect:Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient back-end systems.Work with SQL/MongoDB to manage data storage, queries, and performance optimization for large datasets.Implement RESTful APIs and WebSocket connections for real-time communication between clients and servers.Collaboration with team members to create actionable insights for application features.Contribute to front-end development tasks using React, Next.js, and TypeScript as needed.Participate in debugging and optimizing end-to-end performance, ensuring smooth communication between front-end and back-end systems.Work on server-side architecture in Next.js, building server and client components where appropriate.Ensure robust security practices in API design and data handling.Collaborate with the team on implementing efficient algorithms and optimizing data pipelines.What you’ll need:Pursuing or recently completed a Master’s degree in Computer Science between December 2026-May 2027Strong foundation in back-end development with Python, Node.js, or similar technologies.Familiarity with front-end frameworks such as React or Next.js and understanding of modern UI/UX principles.Experience with database systems like SQL and MongoDB.Familiarity with state management (e.g., Redux) and modular front-end components.Understanding of networking principles, including RESTful APIs and WebSocket connections.Experience with algorithmic problem-solving or data processing workflows.Prudential does not provide visa sponsorship for this position. Successful candidates must possess the requisite US employment authorization to be eligible for consideration.​Prudential Financial, Inc. of the United States is not affiliated with Prudential plc. which is headquartered in the United Kingdom. Prudential is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, ancestry, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, genetics, disability, marital status, age, veteran status, domestic partner status, medical condition or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need an accommodation to complete the application process, please email accommodations.hw@prudential.com.  If you are experiencing a technical issue with your application or an assessment, please email careers.technicalsupport@prudential.com to request assistance.
requirements: Pursuing or recently completed a Master’s degree in Computer Science between December 2026-May 2027
responsibilities: Design, develop, and maintain scalable and efficient back-end systems.
Contribute to front-end development tasks using React, Next.js, and TypeScript as needed.
Collaborate with the team on implementing efficient algorithms and optimizing data pipelines.
Strong foundation in back-end development with Python, Node.js, or similar technologies.
